content.text: The diagram shows a circle, centre \(O.\)
\(AB\) and \(DE\) are chords of the circle
\(M\) is the mid-point of \(AB\) and \(N\) is the mid-point of \(DE\)
Write down all the steps of your working and give your answer as a fraction in its simplest form
Put a ring around the correct statement from the list below
The number of lions in Africa decreases exponentially by \(2\%\) each year
Find the number of lions in Africa after 6 years
Give your answer correct to the nearest hundred
Find the mid-point of \(AB\) where \(A = (w, r)\) and \(B = (3w, t)\)
Give your answer in its simplest form in terms of \(w, r\) and \(t\)
An equilateral triangle has side length \(12\mathrm{cm}\), correct to the nearest centimetre
Find the lower bound and the upper bound of the perimeter of the triangle
These are the first five terms of a sequence
Find an expression for the \(n\)th term of this sequence
By shading the **unwanted** regions of the grid, find and label the region \(R\) that satisfies the following four inequalities
Find the value of \(a\) and the value of \(b\)
The diagram shows the points \(C(-1, 2)\) and \(D(9, 7)\)
Find the equation of the line perpendicular to \(CD\) that passes through the point (1, 3)
Give your answer in the form \(y = mx + c\)
120 students choose what they want to do when they leave school
Their choices are shown in the table
Complete the pie chart to show this information
Using a straight edge and compasses only, construct the bisector of angle \(BCD\)
Draw the locus of the points inside the pentagon that are \(3\mathrm{cm}\) from \(E\)
Shade the region inside the pentagon that is
Make \(m\) the subject of the formula
The diagram shows an equilateral triangle \(ABC\) with sides of length \(10\mathrm{cm}\)
\(AMN\) is a sector of a circle, centre \(A\)
Work out the area of the shaded region
The diagram shows a cuboid with dimensions \(5.5\mathrm{cm}\), \(8\mathrm{cm}\) and \(16.2\mathrm{cm}\)
Calculate the angle between the line \(AB\) and the horizontal base of the cuboid
Write 56 as a product of its prime factors
Find the lowest common multiple (LCM) of 56 and 42
the number of students who spend more than 40 minutes completing their homework
The time, \(t\) minutes, 80 students each spend completing their homework is recorded
The cumulative frequency diagram shows the results
Use the cumulative frequency diagram to find an estimate of

parts.label: (ii)
